author: mrabino1
content: quick question.. and pls correct me where I am wrong on this.. i believe prior to altair, block proposals were "credited" two epochs later... post-altair, it appears like it is the next epoch.. (same for attestations).. did something chnage? or was my understanding off.. happy to get some wisdom ! thx..

author: djrtwo
content:
proposer attestation and sync committee inclusion reawards are done at the exact block
as are sync committee rewards to that committee

author: djrtwo
content: attestation rewards for activity in epoch N are still rewarded at the end of epoch N+1

author: djrtwo
content: (and in phase 0, proposer rewards were batched at epoch boundaries like attesation rewards but no longer as noted above)

author: sauliusgrigaitis
content: Seems that a lot of missed blocks are from validators that look healthy based on their attestations performance ( https://beaconcha.in/validator/223385 https://beaconcha.in/validator/153841 https://beaconcha.in/validator/203050 https://beaconcha.in/validator/121419 ) . Is there a known reason?

author: djrtwo
content: From what I can tell various operators did not properly configure/upgrade their remote signer and/or validator client setup

author: djrtwo
content: the crux here is that the `Attestation` type did not change (and so legacy signing entities can handle the altair attestations) whereas the `BeaconBlock` type did (thus legacy signing software was borked)

author: potuz
content: I think a lesson to be learnt from this event is that clients need to purposely brick their legacy signer, be it remote, or local, when a fork comes

author: djrtwo
content: some (many) institutions use their own remote signer

author: djrtwo
content: it implies that these institutions did *minimal if not zero* testing on altair testnets

author: djrtwo
content: I would suspect they saw a good attestation % nubmer and said "we're good to go"

author: djrtwo
content: or just didn't run on testnets at all

author: potuz
content: From the fixes I've seen being applied on repos I'd suspect is a stock signer. But yeah, failing to propose should pass CI in case of clients and a test on testnets in case of large users
